steps.message: There are three instances we are making, a Jump Server and two Backend Servers

Click the menu button on top left. Scroll down to "Compute" and click "Instances".
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/compute_menu.png}} Then, select the Create Instance button.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/create_instance_button.png}}

You will be redirected to the compute instance creation page. First, let's name our server "jump_server".{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/jump_server_config_1.png}}Next, scroll down and choose or paste your Public SSH Key.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/jump_server_config_2.png}}Finally, we put the instance in our jump_server_subnet.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/jump_server_config_3.png}}Now, let's wait a bit for the server to be created.

At this step, we will SSH into the Jump Server. You can find your Public IP in the Primary VNIC Information section.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/public_ip_address.png}}Now let's open our terminal and SSH into the Jump Server. Run command ssh -i <your private key> opc@<your jump box public ip>{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/ssh_into_jump_server.png}}Once we are in the server, we will create SSH Key Pair for provisioning the Backend Servers. Run ssh-keygen and spam your enter key, we will have ourselves a pair of SSH Keys. Run cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub to get your Public Key. Copy your Public Key and we will use it to create two Backend Servers.
